method.name: emulation_bgp_config
method.description: This procedure configures BGP neighbors, internal and/or external. It is used to create, enable, modify, and to delete an emulated Border Gateway Protocol. User can configure multiple BGP peers per interface by calling this procedure multiple times.

description.text: This option defines the action to be taken on the BGP server.

choice.choiceText: delete the BGP4 configuration, requires the use of -handle.
disable the BGP4 configuration, requires the use of -handle.
enable and/or create the BGP4 configuration. If -handle is specified, then it will be enabled, otherwise created.
create the BGP configuration
modify the BGP4 configuration, requires the use of -handle.
deletes all BGP4 configurations from the -port_handle and then creates the provided BGP4 configuration.

restriction.value: delete disable enable create modify reset

description.text: If set to 1, enables MD5 authentication for emulated BGP node.
The key used for md5 authentication.
The port on which the BGP neighbor is to be created.

BGP handle used for -mode modify/disable/delete. When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology.

This argument determines if individual interface, session or router handles are returned by the current command. This applies only to the command on which it is specified. Setting this to 0 means that only NGPF-specific protocol stack handles will be returned. This will significantly decrease the size of command results and speed up script execution. The default is 0, meaning only protocol stack handles will be returned.
This option defines the IP version of the BGP4 neighbor to be configured on the Ixia interface.

choice.choiceText: IPv4
IPv6

description.text: The IPv4 address of the Ixia simulated BGP node to be emulated.
The gateway IPV4 or IPV6 address of the BGP4 neighbor interface. If this parameter is not provided it will be initialized to the remote_ip_addr value.
The IPv4 address of the DUTs interface connected to the emulated BGP port.
This option is used to support BGP Unnumbered feature. When enabled, local IPv6 will be link-local IP of the interface.
The IPv6 address of the BGP node to be emulated by the test port.
This option is used to auto configure DUT IP. When enabled, DUT IP will be taken from interface gateway IP.

The IPv6 address of the DUT interface connected to emulated BGP node. This parameter is mandatory when -mode is create, -ip_version is 6 and parameter -neighbor_type is external, or -neighbor_type is internal and ipv4_mpls_nlri, ipv6_mpls_nlri, ipv4_mpls_vpn_nlri, and ipv6_mpls_vpn_nlri are not enabled.
Defines the mask and increment step for the next -local_ip_addr or "-local_ipv6_addr".
Defines the mask and increment step for the next -remote_ip_addr or "-remote_ipv6_addr".
This option is used for IPv4 traffic, and enables the use of the BGP NEXT_HOP attributes. When enabled, the IP next hop must be configured (using the -next_hop_ip option).
Defines the IP of the next hop. This option is used if the flag -next_hop_enable is set.
The AS number of the BGP node to be emulated by the test port.
The 4 bytes AS number of the BGP node to be emulated by the test port.
For External BGP type only. This option controls the AS number (local_as) assigned to additional routers.

choice.choiceText: (default) the local_as remains fixed
increments the local_as

description.text: If you configure more then 1 eBGP neighbor on the Ixia interface, and if you select the option local_as_mode to increment, the option local_as_step defines the step by which the AS number is incremented.
The time intervals at which UPDATE messages are sent to the DUT, expressed in the number of milliseconds between UPDATE messages.
Number of BGP nodes to create.
BGP4 router ID of the emulated node, must be in IPv4 format.
BGP4 router ID step of the emulated node, must be in IPv4 format.

Enables vlan on the directly connected BGP router interface. Valid options are: 0 - disable, 1 - enable. This option is valid only when -mode is create or -mode is modify and -handle is a BGP router handle. This option is available only when IxNetwork tcl API is used.
VLAN ID for the emulated router node.
For multiple neighbor configuration, configurest the VLAN ID mode.

Defines the step for every VLAN When -vlan_id_mode is set to increment. When vlan_id_step causes the vlan_id value to exceed it's maximum value the increment will be done modulo <number of possible vlan ids>. Examples: vlan_id = 4094; vlan_id_step = 2 -> new vlan_id value = 0 vlan_id = 4095; vlan_id_step = 11 -> new vlan_id value = 10
The VLAN user priority assigned to emulated router node.

This parameter is valid only for IxTclNetwork API and represents a list of interfaces previously created using interface_config or another emulation__config command that returns the interface handles (for example: BFD).

Starting with IxNetwork 5.60 this parameter accepts handles returned by emulation_dhcp_group_config procedure in the following format: |,-, ... The DHCP ranges are separated from the Interface Index identifiers with the (|) character. The Interface Index identifiers are separated with comas (,). A range of Interface Index identifiers can be defined using the dash (-) character.

Ranges along with the Interface Index identifiers are grouped together in TCL Lists. The lists can contain mixed items, protocol interface handles returned by interface_config and handles returned by emulation_dhcp_group_config along with the interface index.

Example: count 10 (10 BGP neighbors). 3 DHCP range handles returned by ::ixia::emulation_dhcp_group_config. Each DHCP range has 20 sessions (interfaces). If we pass a -interface_handle in the following format: [list $dhcp_r1|1,5 $dhcp_r2|1-3 $dhcp_r3|1,3,5-9,13] The interfaces will be distributed to the routers in the following manner:

    BGP Neighbor 1: $dhcp_r1 -> interface 1

  1. BGP Neighbor 2: $dhcp_r1 -> interface 5
  2. BGP Neighbor 3: $dhcp_r2 -> interface 1
  3. BGP Neighbor 4: $dhcp_r2 -> interface 2
  4. BGP Neighbor 5: $dhcp_r2 -> interface 3
  5. BGP Neighbor 6: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 1
  6. BGP Neighbor 7: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 3
  7. BGP Neighbor 8: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 5
  8. BGP Neighbor 9: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 6
  9. BGP Neighbor 10: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 7
  10. BGP Neighbor 11: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 8
  11. BGP Neighbor 12: $dhcp_r3 -> interface 9
  12. BGP Neighbor 13 $dhcp_r3 -> interface 13

Starting with IxNetwork 6.30SP1 this parameter accepts handles returned by interface_config procedure with -l23_config_type static_type setting in the following format: |,-, ... The IP ranges are separated from the Interface Index identifiers with the (|) character. The Interface Index identifiers are separated with comas (,). A range of Interface Index identifiers can be defined using the dash (-) character.

Ranges along with the Interface Index identifiers are grouped together in TCL Lists. The lists can contain mixed items, protocol interface handles returned by interface_config with -l23_config_type protocol_interface and with -l23_config_type static_type.

Example: count 10 (10 BGP neighbors). 3 IP range handles returned by ::ixia::interface_config. Each IP range has 20 sessions (interfaces). If we pass a -interface_handle in the following format: [list $ip_r1|1,5 $ip_r2|1-3 $ip_r3|1,3,5-9,13] The interfaces will be distributed to the routers in the following manner:

  1. BGP Neighbor 1: $ip_r1 -> interface 1
  2. BGP Neighbor 2: $ip_r1 -> interface 5
  3. BGP Neighbor 3: $ip_r2 -> interface 1
  4. BGP Neighbor 4: $ip_r2 -> interface 2
  5. BGP Neighbor 5: $ip_r2 -> interface 3
  6. BGP Neighbor 6: $ip_r3 -> interface 1
  7. BGP Neighbor 7: $ip_r3 -> interface 3
  8. BGP Neighbor 8: $ip_r3 -> interface 5
  9. BGP Neighbor 9: $ip_r3 -> interface 6
  10. BGP Neighbor 10: $ip_r3 -> interface 7
  11. BGP Neighbor 11: $ip_r3 -> interface 8
  12. BGP Neighbor 12: $ip_r3 -> interface 9
  13. BGP Neighbor 13 $ip_r3 -> interface 13

Valid for mode create for IxTclNetwork only.
Configures the hold time for BGP sessions for this Neighbor. Keepalives are sent out every one-third of this interval. If the default value is 90, KeepAlive messages are sent every 30 seconds.

choice.choiceText: iBGP
eBGP

description.text: Will enable graceful restart (HA) on the BGP4 neighbor.
If -graceful_restart_enable is set, sets the amount of time following a restart operation allowed to re-establish a BGP session, in seconds.

If -graceful_restart_enable is set, sets the amount of time after which an End-Of-RIB marker is sent in an Update message to the peer to allow time for routing convergence via IGP and BGP selection, in seconds. Stale routing information for that address family is then deleted by the receiving peer.
For External BGP neighbor only. The TCP window used for communications from the neighbor.
Enables the BGP4 local router id option.

Netmask represents ipv4_prefix_length / ipv6_prefix_length for Protocol Interface. It is used in case Protocols Interface and BGP is configured from same BGP command without configure IP addresses in interface_config.
Initial MAC address of the interfaces created for the BGP4 neighbor.
The incrementing step for thr MAC address of the dirrectly connected interfaces created for the BGP4 neighbor. This option is valid only when IxTclNetwork API is used.
If checked, this BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports IPv4 MDT address family messages.
If checked, this BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports IPv4 MDT address family messages.

If used, support for IPv4 Unicast is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned routes.

If used, support for IPv4 Unicast is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned routes.

If used, support for IPv6 MPLS VPN is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned routes.
Required when the -ipv4_mpls_vpn_nlri option is used.
Required when the -ipv4_mpls_vpn_nlri option is used.

Required when the -ipv4_mpls_vpn_nlri option is used. This parameter is mandatory when -mode is create, and parameter -neighbor_type is internal and and ipv4_mpls_nlri, ipv6_mpls_nlri, ipv4_mpls_vpn_nlri, and ipv6_mpls_vpn_nlri are enabled.
Required when the -ipv4_mpls_vpn_nlri option is used.
This attribute represents the limited number of iterations that a unit of data can experience before the data is discarded.

When the protocol server operates on older ports that do not possess a local processor, this tuning parameter controls how many UPDATE messages are sent at a time. When many routers are being simulated on such a port, changing this value may help to increase or decrease performance.
Set BFD registration mode to single hop or multi hop.
This BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports BGP/BGP+ VPLS per the Kompella draft. This will enable the L2 Sites. If present, means VPLS capabilities are enabled.
This BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports BGP/BGP+ VPLS per the Kompella draft. This will enable the L2 Sites. If present, means VPLS capabilities are enabled.
This BGP/BGP+ router/peer supports BGP/BGP+ VPLS per the Kompella draft. This will enable the L2 Sites. If present, means VPLS capabilities are enabled.
BGP ID Same as Router ID
When the -staggered_start_enable flag is used, this is the duration of the start process in seconds.
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action (rate = count/interval)
Number of times an action is triggered per time interval
Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group

choice.choiceText: The values regarding start rate are mapped per device group
The values regarding start rate are mapped per port

description.text: Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action (rate = count/interval)
Number of times an action is triggered per time interval
Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group

choice.choiceText: The values regarding stop rate are mapped per device group
The values regarding stop rate are mapped per port

description.text: For External BGP neighbor. If set, a HELLO message is actively sent when BGP testing starts. Otherwise, the port waits for the DUT to send its HELLO message.
Disable Received Update Validation (Enabled for High Performance)
Enable AD VPLS Prefix Length in Bits
Request VPN Label Exchange over LSP
For External routing only. Optional setup for the AS-Path.

choice.choiceText: Include Local AS as AS-SEQ
Include Local AS as AS-SEQ-Confederation
Include Local AS as AS-SET
Include Local AS as AS-SET-Confederation
Don't include Local AS
Prepend Local AS to first segment

restriction.value: include_as_seq include_as_seq_conf include_as_set include_as_set_conf no_include prepend_as

description.text: The ID of the router to be emulated.
The value use to increment the router_id when count > 1. (DEFAULT = 0.0.0.1)

If used, support for Link State is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned Link State

If used, support for Link State is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned Link State

choice.choiceText: Community type "No Export"
Community type "No Advertised"
Community type "Noexport Subconfed"
Community type "Manual"
Extended Community type - Admin AS number 2 octet
Extended Community type - Admin IP address
Extended Community type - Admin AS number 4 octet

Extended Community type - EVPN
Extended Community sub type - Route target
Extended Community sub type - Origin
Extended Community sub type - Extended bandwidth
Extended Community sub type - encapsulation
Extended Community sub type - MacAddress

description.text: BGP LS Ext Target Assigned Number 4
BGP LS Ext Target Assigned Number 2
For External routing only. Optional setup for the AS-Path.

choice.choiceText: BGP-LS As Set Mode - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ
BGP-LS As Set Mode - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ-Confederation
BGP-LS As Set Mode - Include Local AS as AS-SET
BGP-LS As Set Mode - Include Local AS as AS-SET-Confederation
BGP-LS As Set Mode - Don't include Local AS
BGP-LS As Set Mode - Prepend Local AS to first segment

restriction.value: include_as_seq include_as_seq_conf include_as_set include_as_set_conf no_include prepend_as

choice.choiceText: AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SEQ-Confederation
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SET
AS Path Segment Type - Include Local AS as AS-SET-Confederation

restriction.value: type0 type1 type2 type3 type4 type5

description.text: Advertise Aliasing Automatically when the protocol starts
Advertise Aliasing before AD Per ES Route

choice.choiceText: Per Ethernet Tag
Per Evi

description.text: Support Inclusive Multicast Ethernet Tag Route (RT Type 3)
Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario
MPLS Labels Count For IPv4 MPLS Route
MPLS Labels Count For IPv6 MPLS Route
Number of User Defined Custom AFI-SAFI
Select the Active check box to activate the Custom AFI SAFI.
AFI Value for Custom AFI SAFI.
SAFI Value for Custom AFI SAFI.
Length in bytes for Custom AFI SAFI.
Data Value for Custom AFI SAFI.

If used, support for IPv4 Unicast FlowSpec is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned routes.

If used, support for IPv6 Unicast FlowSpec is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned routes.
Always Include Tunnel Encapsulation Extended Community
Label to be used for Route Type 2 carrying IRB MAC and/or IRB IP in Route Type 2

If used, support for IPv6 SRTE Policies is advertised in the Capabilities Optional Parameter / Multiprotocol Extensions parameter in the OPEN message and in addition, for IxTclNetwork, also sets the filters for the respective learned routes.
SR TE Policy Tunnel Encaps Attribute Type

returnValue.value: A list containing the lscommunities rtr protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the lsaspath rtr protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the bgp ethernet segment protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the bgp b mac mapped ip protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
When status is $::FAILURE, contains more information
Handle of bgpipv4peer or bgpipv6peer configured
Item Handle of any bgpipv4peer or bgpipv6peer configured Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

notes.note: Coded versus functional specification. When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handles, lscommunities_handles_rtr, lsaspath_handles_rtr

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ixiangpf.emulation_bgp_config # This example below will create a BGP router
status = ixiangpf.emulation_bgp_config( mode = "create", active = "1", handle = "<ipv4_handle>", count = "10", hold_time = "30", ip_version = "4", local_ip_addr = "200.1.1.1", md5_enable = "1", md5_key = "34567", remote_ip_addr = "201.1.1.2", restart_time = "100", retry_time = "200", ) # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1' , 'bgp_handle' : 'bgp4Peerhandle'} # This example will modify the just created BGP Router by using the BGP Router handle
status = ixiangpf.emulation_bgp_config( mode = "modify", handle = "<bgp_handle>", remote_ip_addr = "100.2.0.1", bfd_registration = "1", ) # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1'} # This example will remove the BGP router
status = ixiangpf.emulation_bgp_config( mode = "delete", handle = "<bgp_handle>", ) # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1'} # This example will configure a BGP+ router
status = ixiangpf.emulation_bgp_config( mode = "enable", active = "1", md5_enable = "0", md5_key = "Ixia", handle = "<ipv6_1_handle>", ip_version = "6", remote_ipv6_addr = "::", next_hop_enable = "0", next_hop_ip = "0.0.0.0", enable_4_byte_as = "0", local_as = "0", local_as4 = "0", update_interval = "0", count = "1", hold_time = "90", neighbor_type = "internal", graceful_restart_enable = "0", restart_time = "45", ) # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1', 'bgp_handle' : 'bgp6PeerHandle'}

# Command :- ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_config # This example below will create a BGP router my $bgp_ipv4_peer_status = ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_config ({ mode => "create", active => "1", handle => "<ipv4_handle>", count => "10", hold_time => "30", ip_version => "4", local_ip_addr => "200.1.1.1", md5_enable => "1", md5_key => "34567", remote_ip_addr => "201.1.1.2", restart_time => "100", retry_time => "200", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {bgp_handle bgp4Peerhandle} # This example will modify the just created BGP Router by using the BGP Router handle my $bgp_modified = ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_config ({ mode => "modify", handle => "<bgp_handle>", remote_ip_addr => "100.2.0.1", bfd_registration => "1", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} # This example will remove the BGP router my $bgp_removed = ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_config ({ mode => "delete", handle => "<bgp_handle>", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} # This example will configure a BGP+ router my $bgp_ipv6_peer_1_status = ixiangpf::emulation_bgp_config ({ mode => "enable", active => "1", md5_enable => "0", md5_key => "Ixia", handle => "<ipv6_1_handle>", ip_version => "6", remote_ipv6_addr => "::", next_hop_enable => "0", next_hop_ip => "0.0.0.0", enable_4_byte_as => "0", local_as => "0", local_as4 => "0", update_interval => "0", count => "1", hold_time => "90", neighbor_type => "internal", graceful_restart_enable => "0", restart_time => "45", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {bgp_handle bgp6PeerHandle}

# Command :- Emulation Bgp Config # This example below will create a BGP router
${result} = Emulation Bgp Config mode=create active=1 handle=<ipv4_handle> count=10 hold_time=30 ip_version=4 local_ip_addr=200.1.1.1 ... md5_enable=1 md5_key=34567 remote_ip_addr=201.1.1.2 restart_time=100 retry_time=200 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${bgp_ipv4_peer_status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} bgp_ipv4_peer_status
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1' , 'bgp_handle' : 'bgp4Peerhandle'} # This example will modify the just created BGP Router by using the BGP Router handle
${result} = Emulation Bgp Config mode=modify handle=<bgp_handle> remote_ip_addr=100.2.0.1 bfd_registration=1 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${bgp_modified} = Get From Dictionary ${result} bgp_modified
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} # This example will remove the BGP router
${result} = Emulation Bgp Config Emulation Bgp Config mode=delete handle=<bgp_handle> ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${bgp_removed} = Get From Dictionary ${result} bgp_removed
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1'} # This example will configure a BGP+ router
${result} = Emulation Bgp Config mode=enable active=1 md5_enable=0 ... md5_key=Ixia handle=<ipv6_1_handle> ip_version=6 remote_ipv6_addr=:: next_hop_enable=0 next_hop_ip=0.0.0.0 ... enable_4_byte_as=0 local_as=0 local_as4=0 update_interval=0 count=1 hold_time=90 neighbor_type=internal ... graceful_restart_enable=0 restart_time=45 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${bgp_ipv6_peer_1_status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} bgp_ipv6_peer_1_status
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {'status' : '1', 'bgp_handle' : 'bgp6PeerHandle'}
